DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator protocol eligibility question to ask whether the patient has clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to established or verified identification by signs and symptoms of malignant tumor spread from an original (primary) site to another location in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have clinica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a complete work-up staging to rule-out presence of metastatic disease that included a Chest X-ray and/or a CT scan of the throax with IV contrast, as well as a CT of the pelvis and abdomen with IV and PO contrast performed using multi-detector CT and equal or less than 5mm slice thickness?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease for this patient?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there  radiologic evidence of metastatic disease seen on last imaging?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease as defined?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was there evidence of disease on post-operative imaging?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease by either MRI evaluation (brain and spine)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evidence of metastatic disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: Disease Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the patient diagnosed with metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease including lymph nodes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evidence of distant metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have radiographically detectable metastatic disease on CT or bone scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have metastatic disease by either MRI evaluation (brain or spine)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does FDG PET/CT confirm no evidence of distant metastases?
